oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Hollywood Barn Dance - Unknown date - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS program The Hollywood Barn Dance, unknown date (circa 1946), part 1. Featuring CBS announcer Tom Hanlon, host Cottonseed Clark, and performers Foy Willing and the Riders of the Purple Sage, Merle Travis, Colleen Summers (Mary Ford), Jerry Hilliard, Leo Carrillo, Tex Atchison, Deuce Spriggins and his Western Swing Band, the Sunshine Girls (Colleen Summers, Vivian Earles, 'Carol' (likely Colleen's sister, unconfirmed)), and Johnny Bond. Held at the Western Palisades Ballroom on the Santa Monica Pier.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Foy Willing; Riders Of The Purple Sage; Merle Travis; Colleen Summers; Mary Ford; Jerry Hilliard; Leo Carrillo; Tex Atchison
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Tom Hanlon) -- Theme -- Opening statement (Cottonseed Clark) -- A Cowboy Has To Sing (Foy Willing and the Riders Of The Purple Sage) -- Cottonseed Clark introduces Merle Travis -- Casey Jones (Merle Travis) -- Cottonseed Clark introduces Colleen Summers -- Someday (You'll Want Me To Want You) (Colleen Summers) -- Cottonseed Clark introduces Jerry Hilliard -- New San Antonio Rose (Jerry Hilliard harmonica) -- Cottonseed Clark introduces Leo Carrillo -- Leo Carrillo recites a poem -- Cottonseed Clark introduces Tex Atchison -- [Unidentified fiddle tune with calls] (Tex Atchison fiddle) [continued in part 2] -- Cottonseed Clark talks
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Hollywood barn dance (Radio program); Hanlon, Tom, 1907-1970; Clark, Cottonseed; Willing, Foy, 1914-1978; Riders of the Purple Sage; Travis, Merle; Ford, Mary, 1924-1977; Hilliard, Jerry, 1918-2010; Carrillo, Leo; Atchison, Tex; Spriggins, Deuce; Sunshine Girls (Musical group); Bond, Johnny, 1915-1978
